criticism: The mintTokens function does not check for overflow, allowing the ICO contract to mint an arbitrary large amount of tokens for any beneficiary.
The transfer function does not check for overflow, allowing the token owner to overflow the recipient's balance, leading to loss of funds.
The transferFrom function does not check for overflow, allowing the token owner to overflow the recipient's balance, leading to loss of funds.
The burnTokens function allows the owner to burn any amount of tokens from any user, which can be exploited to prevent these tokens from ever being recoverable.
The freezeTransfersUntil function is only protected by a single owner modifier, allowing it to be called by any user, not just the owner.
